habitat_description: Wandering salamanders were described as a species separate from A. ferreus - Clouded salamander - by Wake and Jackman (1999) who identified genetic differernces in mitochondrial DNA and allozymes. Both species have very similar habitat requirements relating to mature forests, however Wake and Jackman (1999) noted that unlike A. ferreus, A. vagrans do not utilize rocky slopes and talus habitats (Lannoo et al. 2005). Like A. ferreus, A. vagrans is an arboreal salamander of northern CA inhabiting the canopy and sloughing bark of mature Douglas fir and Redwood forests as well as stumps and logs along the forest floor (Welsh and Lind 1988, 1991, Brown 1948, Jackman 1999, Storer 1925, Bury and Martin 1973, Thomas et al. 1993).
